executive_summary:
Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2024 currency.

Private banks have grown recently as wealth managers have capitalized on the growing number of millionaires in emerging markets. The relative strength of the US economy has propelled private banks, as wealthy individuals worldwide have sought to park their wealth in secure assets like urban real estate. Even amid the pandemic in 2020, market accumulation spurred growth. Overall, the need for private banking services has increased as the global number of high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth individuals has grown. Industry-wide revenue has been growing at a CAGR of 5.0% to $95.9 billion over the past five years, including an expected jump of 3.6% in 2024 alone.

## Key Growth Driver

A key theme driving growth is the rise of globalization. During the period, wealthy individuals expanded in regions outside the US, most notably the Asia-Pacific region. In turn, wealth managers have increasingly engaged in cross-border wealth management practices to push up assets under management. The Russia-Ukraine conflict, compounded by rising interest rates, induced volatility in capital markets and increased investor uncertainty, driving clients to private banks.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Outbreak of the Pandemic Had Mixed Effects
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: - The pandemic caused volatility in capital markets in 2020, which led to a surge in global investor uncertainty, spurring growth for private banks as consumers sought professionals to manage their money. - Private banks enjoyed increased assets under management as capital markets recovered from the initial shocks of the pandemic. - Interest rates declined significantly in 2020. Lower interest rates in 2020 spurred the economy, leading to lower profit and growth for private banks because of lower loan and deposit revenue.

- Economic growth in Asia and the Middle East has increased the number of high-net-worth (HNW) and ultra-high-net-worth (UHNW) individuals abroad. This has contributed to increased revenue for operators. - Domestic wealth managers have expanded their services to appeal to foreign markets while increasingly branding their operations as global to attract foreign high net worth individuals.

High competition among private banks will spur increased investment in value-added services to attract clients. Overall, industry revenue is forecast to grow at a CAGR of 3.0% to $111.2 billion over the five years to 2029.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Private banks' efforts to appeal to foreign HNW and UHNW individuals have come with substantial difficulty because of the regulatory and tax complications of transferring wealth overseas.
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite these headwinds, US real estate markets' stability and relative outperformance, particularly in New York and Florida, continue to attract foreign investment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: INVESTOR UNCERTAINTY SURROUNDING THE RUSSIA-UKRAINE CONFLICT AND INTEREST RATE HIKES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Russia-Ukraine conflict and interest rate hikes induced volatility in capital markets in 2022, increasing investor uncertainty and hindering the performance of assets in the equity market. Interest rate hikes led to falling equity values, but private banks took advantage of higher rates and enjoyed growth from fixed-income securities such as bonds in 2022. In addition, profit climbed in the same year due to greater revenue from loans and deposits. According to data from Altrara, the number of UHNW individuals fell in the first half of 2022 because of equity market volatility, decreasing the potential pool of clients for private banks.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: RISING EQUITY VALUES HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO INDUSTRY REVENUE GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite volatility throughout the period, equity markets have climbed. The S&P 500 has climbed substantially, boosting asset values and contributing to

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: High-Interest Rates Will Have Mixed Effects
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: - Higher interest rates will subdue growth for private banks as limited market appreciation will hinder growth in assets under management and lower trading volumes reducing growth from management fees. - The high interest rate environment will enable private banks to benefit from fixed-income securities, loans and deposits, which will limit declines in industry profit. Although industry profit will remain high.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Wealth Worldwide Will Be a Boon
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: - The greatest opportunity for industry growth over the next five years will be the rising number of high-net-worth (HNW) individuals who have between $1.0 million and $10.0 million to invest. - The high net worth market will enjoy asset growth, so private banks need to reorient their operations to deliver value to these clients while designing more standardized services that suit this market's needs. - Some services include income generation and lifestyle planning for retirees, credit lending for entrepreneurs and investment strategies for certain groups.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Competition Among Private Banks Will Mount
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As private banks compete for newly wealthy individuals, they must demonstrate their value amid tremendous competition from full-service securities brokerages, financial planners and advisors. Private banks should focus on scale to deliver value-added services cost-effectively, as heightened competition will put downward pressure on financial services. Some value-added services include user-friendly platforms that enable clients to access their assets across divisions in a parent company and compare portfolio performance.

industry_definition: The Private Banking Services industry comprises banking institutions that actively manage wealth for clients with investable assets exceeding $1.0 million. Private banks have the ability to make investment decisions and generate revenue through fees that are based on asset management, portfolio performance and specialty wealth-advisory services.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level high - increasing

key_trends: Private banks primarily compete based on reputation and fees.
Private banks must provide highly personalized services and uphold professional standards that place the client's needs before those of the company.
Private banks enjoy minimal external competition. Successful private banks have an established reputation by continuously demonstrating expertise in wealth management, reducing external competition.

Assets under management increased despite the pandemic. Investor uncertainty and a rebound in capital markets following the initial dip in 2020 led to increased assets under management, but lower interest rates hindered profit growth.
High-interest rates will bolster profit. Private banks enjoy higher profit when interest rates are higher because of greater growth from loans and deposits.
Just two companies have amassed 5.0% of the market. Morgan Stanley and JP Morgan have accumulated their market share by having more assets under management than other private bankers.

Even massive financial institutions face difficulty accumulating considerable market share. Despite the size and reputation of private banks like Bank of America and Wells Fargo, they have struggled to gain significant market share in private banking services.
Private banks' market share is limited Despite the presence of major banks like Bank of America and Wells Fargo, these companies haven't amassed more than 5.0% of the market.

Private bankers are highly regulated Private bankers are highly regulated. The US Securities and Exchange Commission regulates private banks under numerous laws like the Investment Company Act, the Securities Act and Investment Advisers Act.
Private bankers receive little assistance Private bankers don't receive private assistance but have recently received public aid through loans under the Paycheck Protection Program.
Private banks' profit is high Considerable market appreciation has driven an expansion in assets under management and higher interest rates have enabled private banks to enjoy significant profit.
Wage costs climb due to high competition Compensation to wealth managers is increasing and has grown as a share of revenue.
Proximity to downstream markets is crucial The population's wealth and the number of financial institutions in a particular region encourage private banks to establish.
New York's wealthy population drives private banks to the Mid-Atlantic Various financial institutions in the region also attract private banks to the region.

Volatility in equity markets limited the number of ultra-high-net-worth individuals The Russia-Ukraine conflict and interest rate hikes led to considerable volatility in equity markets, limiting the number of ultra-high-net-worth individuals in 2022.

Interest rate hikes expand investment in fixed-income assets. Considerable volatility in stock prices, driven by interest rate hikes, led to increased investment into safer fixed-income assets and cash and equivalent assets.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The market of high-net-worth individuals comprises individuals with $1.0 million and $10.0 million in investable assets. This market accounts for over three-quarters of industry revenue. There is a much larger pool of clients with assets between these figures; most clients typically expect their private banker to manage their assets directly.

tier_1_suppliers: Business Analytics & Enterprise Software Publishing in the US
Internet Service Providers in the US
Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US
Wired Telecommunications Carriers in the US
Data Processing & Hosting Services in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Strong growth in the S&P 500 attracts investment
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Investment in equities by private banks includes large-cap stocks (market capitalization of at least $10.0 billion) and small- and mid-cap stocks. The equities segment comprises over one half of industry revenue. The S&P 500 has faced considerable volatility over the past five years but has grown overall, leading investment into equities to expand. Growth in equities has continued the strong growth in the segment during the current period.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Interest rate hikes expand investment in fixed-income assets and cash and equivalent assets
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Fixed income assets include all assets that provide owners with a set income stream. The most common form of fixed-income assets includes corporate and government bonds while cash and equivalent assets include currency, government treasury bills and commercial paper.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The hike in interest rates to combat high inflation has limited investment in alternative assets
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Alternative assets include hedge funds, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and commodity funds. Some alternative assets, such as real estate, can be used as a hedge against high inflation. The low-interest rate environment in 2020 and 2021 led to an influx in residential real estate investments. However, as interest rates have risen, this activity has slowed, putting downward pressure on the alternative assets segment.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Investment in other and balanced assets remains stable
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Other and balanced assets include target date and liability-driven investments (LDIs). Target date funds have become more popular with 401(k) investors as private bankers move the allocation of investments in the fund from riskier to safer assets as the client's retirement approaches. LDIs are common with defined-benefit pension plans to accumulate assets to meet current and future liabilities. Other investment options have remained stable over the past five years.

business_locations.location_description: Several factors impact the distribution of private banks - The geographic distribution of private banks is highly reliant on the population's wealth in a particular region. - Other financial institutions in a particular region contribute to the number of private banks.

California is a boon to the West - Many wealthy individuals in California attract private banks to the West. - Advanced capital markets in California contribute to the state's dominance in the region.

The Mid-Atlantic is home to many private banks - The Mid-Atlantic is known as the financial capital of the US because of the presence of the New York Stock Exchange, Federal Reserve and other vital institutions in the region. Many investment bankers and securities dealers, who are potential clients, in New York, attract private banks.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The SEC administers and enforces federal securities laws to protect investors and maintain fair, honest, efficient securities markets.
Under the Investment Company Act, the SEC regulates the composition of board directors, capital structures, and transactions with affiliated persons.
The Securities Act of 1933 requires federal registration of all public securities offerings and provides all prospective investors with a current prospectus.
The Investment Advisers Act of 1940 requires federal registration of all investment advisers.

regulations_points.regulation_title: DODD-FRANK WALL STREET REFORM AND CONSUMER PROTECTION ACT
regulations_points.regulation_description: The 2010 Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and its key provision, the Volcker Rule, started lawmakers' response to designing a regulatory framework identifying systemic financial risks and preventing future crises.
The Regulatory Relief Act primarily scaled back compliance measures imposed by Dodd-Frank.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The private banking industry is mature.
The industry has high revenue volatility.
The industry receives low and steady assistance.
There is a high level of technology change in the industry.
The industry has a high and increasing level of globalization.
There is high and increasing competition in the industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Private banks primarily compete based on reputation and fees. They must provide highly personalized services and uphold professional standards.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Morgan Stanley, JP Morgan Chase, Bank of America and Wells Fargo are the four most prominent private banks contributing to the moderate market share concentration.
Market share concentration has fallen due to Wells Fargo's assets under management dipping significantly since the company's fake account scandal.

Many private banks are family offices with a small team managing wealth of one or several families with over $10 million in assets. Other small firms include boutique private banks with fewer assets than top banks.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: OTHER COSTS DROP DESPITE INCREASED INVESTMENT IN TECHNOLOGY
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Other costs include purchasing and selling financial instruments, compliance, data processing, other computer services and outsourcing. These costs are required for day-to-day operations.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PRIVATE BANKS ENCOUNTER SHRINKING PROFIT, ALTHOUGH PROFIT REMAINS HIGH
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As AUM expands, private banks generate more fees per wealth management representative. Interest rate hikes have also enabled profit to remain high through greater revenue from loans and deposits.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wages Costs Climb Due to the Industr's Highly Competitive Nature
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Given the industry's highly competitive nature, private banks must increasingly compensate wealth managers well. The relationships wealth managers foster with clients commonly outweigh clients' loyalty to a particular firm, so they generously compensate highly-capable wealth managers.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Given that the majority of assets that private bankers invest in are equities, the performance of the S&P 500 impacts industry revenue volatility considerably.

volatility_points.volatility_title: CHANGES IN THE LEVEL OF INTEREST RATES
volatility_points.volatility_description: When interest rate levels change, customers look to private bankers to properly allocate their money to make the largest return and limit risk exposure in financial markets.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Private banks are using AI to assist in stock-picking and performance-tracking applications.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DEVELOPING A SECURE SYSTEM FOR CLIENTS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Private banks invest heavily in cyber security to avoid data breaches of confidential information or loss of funds.

FAQs.question: What is the systemically important financial institution (SIFI) threshold expansion?
FAQs.answer: The SIFI threshold will be increased gradually over 18 months, from $50.0 billion to $250.0 billion, with a SIFI threshold of $100.0 billion effective immediately.

FAQs.question: How did COVID-19 impact the industry?
FAQs.answer: To help curb the spread of the coronavirus pandemic, local and state governments enforced social distancing guidelines and regulations. Accordingly, large swaths of the economy had to shut down and temporarily close, while others could operate while following specific health and safety guidelines.

FAQs.question: Does the industry receive any private assistance?
FAQs.answer: The private banking services industry doesn't receive any private assistance.
